evGuide.seoTitle: EV Training Guide ‚Äî PokeMMO Knowledge Assist
evGuide.seoDescription: Complete guide to EV training in PokeMMO: best 10 EV/horde spots near Pok√©Centers, essential items, Power Item math, and efficient strategies for competitive Pok√©mon.
evGuide.title: üìä EV Training Guide
evGuide.description: Everything you need to know about Effort Values in PokeMMO. Best horde spots that give 10 EVs per battle near Pok√©Centers, essential items, and efficient strategies to build competitive Pok√©mon.
evGuide.evsExplanation: Effort Values (EVs) are hidden stats that your Pok√©mon gains by defeating other Pok√©mon in battle. Every wild or trainer Pok√©mon gives a specific amount of EVs in one or more stats when defeated. These EVs directly increase your Pok√©mon's stats, making EV training essential for competitive play.
evGuide.evSplitExplanation: In practice, most competitive Pok√©mon are trained with 252 / 252 / 4 splits ‚Äî maxing out two key stats and putting the leftover 4 EVs into a third. The stats you choose depend on the Pok√©mon's role on your team.
evGuide.howItWorks: How EV Training Works in PokeMMO
evGuide.howItWorksDesc: PokeMMO uses horde encounters as the primary EV training method, which is faster than single-battle training.
evGuide.hordeExplanation: Hordes are groups of 5 wild Pok√©mon that appear at once. Defeating all 5 gives EVs from each one ‚Äî meaning 5√ó the EVs per battle. The best spots have Pok√©mon that each yield 2 EVs = 10 EVs per horde. Combined with items, you can fully EV train a stat in minutes. Use a Pok√©mon with a spread move (Earthquake, Surf, Heat Wave, etc.) to KO the entire horde in one turn.
evGuide.vitaminsExplanation: Use Vitamins (Protein, Iron, Calcium, etc.) to add up to 252 EVs per stat instantly. Each vitamin gives +10 EVs. If you use 10 Vitamins (100 EVs), you only need to horde train the remaining 152 EVs ‚Äî just 4 hordes with a Power Item. This saves significant time if you have the money.
evGuide.checkEvsExplanation: In PokeMMO, you can view your Pok√©mon's EVs in the Summary screen. The game shows the exact EV distribution in a hexagonal chart, making it easy to track your progress without external tools.
evGuide.essentialItemsDesc: These items make EV training faster and more efficient.

machoBrace.name: Macho Brace
machoBrace.effect: Doubles all EVs gained from battle. Halves Speed during battle. With a 10 EV/horde spot ‚Üí 20 EVs per horde.
machoBrace.tip: Accessible early. Buy from Battle Frontier shops or GTL. Good option before you get Power Items.

powerItems.name: Power Items
powerItems.effect: Adds +8 EVs in a specific stat per Pok√©mon defeated. With a 10 EV/horde spot ‚Üí 50 EVs per horde in the target stat.
powerItems.tip: Power Weight (HP), Power Bracer (Atk), Power Belt (Def), Power Lens (SpA), Power Band (SpD), Power Anklet (Spd). Best EV multiplier in game.

vitamins.name: Vitamins
vitamins.effect: Gives +10 EVs instantly in a specific stat. Can be used until the stat reaches 252 EVs.
vitamins.tip: HP Up, Protein, Iron, Calcium, Zinc, Carbos. Expensive but saves time. Use first to frontload EVs, then horde train the rest.

evBerries.name: EV Reducing Berries
evBerries.effect: Removes 10 EVs from a specific stat per berry used.
evBerries.tip: Pomeg (HP), Kelpsy (Atk), Qualot (Def), Hondew (SpA), Grepa (SpD), Tamato (Spd). Essential for fixing EV mistakes.

evGuide.bestSpotsDesc: All spots below yield 10 EVs per horde (2 EVs √ó 5 Pok√©mon), have 100% encounter rate, and are close to a Pok√©Center.
evGuide.commonSpreadsDesc: Standard EV distributions for different competitive roles.
evGuide.checklistDesc: Follow these steps for fast and efficient EV training.
steps: Decide your EV spread based on the Pok√©mon's role (sweeper, tank, etc.)
Use Vitamins first ‚Äî add up to 100 EVs per stat instantly (costs money but saves time)
Equip Macho Brace or the appropriate Power Item on your Pok√©mon
Go to the recommended horde spot for the stat you're training
Use a strong Pok√©mon with a spread move (Surf, Earthquake, etc.) at the front of your party
Put the Pok√©mon being trained in your party ‚Äî it gets EVs from Exp Share
Battle hordes until you hit 252 EVs in that stat (check the Summary screen)
Repeat for the second stat, then put the remaining 4 EVs wherever you want
If you made a mistake, use EV-reducing berries to fix it

moneyGuide.seoTitle: Money Making Guide ‚Äî PokeMMO Knowledge Assist
moneyGuide.seoDescription: Learn the best methods to earn Pok√©Yen in PokeMMO: gym reruns, berry farming, trainer rebattles, GTL trading, and more.
moneyGuide.title: üí∞ Money Making Guide
moneyGuide.description: Master the art of earning Pok√©Yen in PokeMMO. From gym reruns to GTL trading, learn the most effective methods to fund your competitive teams, shinies, and cosmetics.
moneyGuide.pokeyenExplanation: Pok√©Yen (¬•) is the main currency in PokeMMO. You need it for virtually everything: buying items, TMs, vitamins, breeding, entering facilities, cosmetics, and trading on the Global Trade Link (GTL). Unlike single-player Pok√©mon games where money is abundant, PokeMMO's economy is player-driven and inflationary, making efficient money-making a critical skill.
moneyGuide.methodsDesc: Here are the most popular and effective ways to earn Pok√©Yen, ranked by accessibility and consistency.

gymReruns.name: Gym Reruns
gymReruns.description: The most popular and consistent money-making method in PokeMMO. After completing a region's storyline, you can rebattle all Gym Leaders. The key is having a fast, optimized team that can sweep each gym quickly.
details: Requires completing the region's Elite Four first
Gyms reset on a cooldown (approximately 18 hours)
Use Amulet Coin to double prize money from trainer battles
Best regions for reruns: Kanto and Unova (highest payouts)
A good sweep team like Cloyster (Shell Smash + Skill Link) or Cinccino (Technician) can clear fast
With Amulet Coin, expect ~150k‚Äì300k per full gym run depending on the region
All 4 regions (Kanto, Johto, Hoenn, Sinnoh, Unova) can be run in rotation for maximum income

trainerRebattles.name: Trainer Rebattles
trainerRebattles.description: After beating the storyline, NPC trainers across the map can be rebattled on a cooldown. "Rich trainers" (those who give the most money) are the priority targets. Pair with Amulet Coin for double rewards.
details: Trainers reset approximately every 6 hours after being defeated
Focus on "Rich Boy", "Lady", and "Gentleman" trainer classes ‚Äî they pay the most
Amulet Coin is essential to double all earnings
Search PokeMMO forums for updated rich trainer location maps
Can be combined with gym reruns in the same session
Using a Pok√©mon with Pay Day (e.g., Persian) adds a small bonus per battle

leppaBerryFarming.name: Leppa Berry Farming
leppaBerryFarming.description: One of the most passive income methods. Leppa Berries are always in demand because they restore PP and are essential for horde EV training. Plant them, wait for the growth cycle, harvest, and sell on the GTL.
details: Leppa Berries take approximately 4‚Äì8 hours to grow depending on watering
Best planting spots: Abundant Shrine area in Unova and various berry plots across regions
Plant in all available berry slots across multiple regions for maximum yield
Can be done on multiple accounts for massive passive income
Takes only ~5 minutes per account to plant and harvest
Also consider farming Lum Berries (cure all status) which sell well for competitive players

gtlTrading.name: GTL Trading (Global Trade Link)
gtlTrading.description: The GTL is PokeMMO's player-driven marketplace. Experienced players buy low and sell high, flipping items, breeding materials, and competitive Pok√©mon. This requires market knowledge and initial capital.
details: Study price trends for popular items (vitamins, evolution stones, TMs)
Buy Pok√©mon with good IVs/natures cheaply and resell at higher prices
Breeding materials (Dittos with specific IVs) are always in high demand
Event items often spike in price after events end ‚Äî stock up during events
Requires initial capital and patience to learn the market
Watch for underpriced listings and snipe good deals
Use the GTL's filter and sorting systems to find bargains

pickupFarming.name: Pickup Farming
pickupFarming.description: The Pickup ability lets Pok√©mon randomly find items after battle. A team of 5+ Pok√©mon with Pickup (like Meowth, Zigzagoon, or Linoone) will accumulate valuable items over time while you do other activities.
details: Higher level Pok√©mon with Pickup find better items
At level 41+, you can find Rare Candies, PP Ups, and more
Best Pok√©mon: Linoone (fast + Pickup), Meowth (Pickup + Pay Day)
Works well when combined with EV training or leveling
Collect and sell valuable items on the GTL periodically
Passive income ‚Äî items accumulate while doing other things

catchingSelling.name: Catching & Selling Pok√©mon
catchingSelling.description: Catching wild Pok√©mon with good IVs, natures, or in useful egg groups and selling them on the GTL. Safari Zone Pok√©mon in valuable egg groups with good IVs are a classic moneymaker.
details: Focus on Pok√©mon in popular egg groups (Dragon, Monster, Field)
Good IVs in even one stat can sell well if the egg group is valuable
Safari Zone is cost-efficient: entry fee includes 30 balls
Magikarp (Water 2 + Dragon egg group) with good IVs sell well for breeders
Ditto with specific IVs are extremely valuable on the GTL
Check current GTL prices before farming to know what's profitable
Chansey/Blissey catching for Lucky Eggs is also a viable method

eventParticipation.name: Event Participation
eventParticipation.description: PokeMMO runs regular events such as PvP tournaments, catch events, and seasonal activities (Halloween, Christmas, Lunar New Year). These often give exclusive cosmetics, items, and direct Pok√©Yen rewards.
details: Check the PokeMMO forums and in-game announcements for scheduled events
Seasonal events (Halloween, Christmas, Lunar New Year) are the biggest
Raid events give large amounts of money and rare items
Event-exclusive items and cosmetics can be held and sold later at a premium
PvP tournaments offer Pok√©Yen prizes and bragging rights
Participating consistently is one of the best ways for newer players to earn
